alert.note: Alert for Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 1:18PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Teller and west central El Paso Counties through 145 PM MDT... At 117 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pikes Peak, or 14 miles west of Colorado Springs, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, torrential rainfall, and up to half inch hail over the higher terrain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pikes Peak. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft; Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft
